column4: is it possible (generally speaking) for two separate linux distros to use the same /home if the distros and /home are all on separate partitions?
errm, I don't see how a symlink would help with what I'm thinking
oh.. I probably misunderstood you. what were you thinking?
if you have a filesystem that's going to be tracked under 2 different OS's, those OS's might give the same "user" different UIDs.  But UIDs are just numbers that are stored along with the file
will that create incompatabilities or just a (very) slightly larger /home?
possible?  Almost certainly.  Easy?  I wouldn't count on it.
